parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural

str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
